Thought we had found the next best Mexican food restaurant in the valley next to Jalapeño Inferno in Scottsdale. We came back and we're expecting the same experience and sadly we were let down. Chips were cold and stale, salsa wasn't good and we paid to have a the chunky salsa and that was a let down as well. Our food arrived and first bite I find myself gagging on a 12" long thick stand of hair that was inside my fundido chimichanga. The waitress came by about 5 mins after this happened and sent the food back to be remade. By the time the food was back out the rest of the table was finished with their food and ready to leave. I was so grossed out I couldn't even eat my food. I left hungry and will not be returning.

I've been coming here for 10 years now and can say without a doubt that this is the best Mexican food on this earth.  If you want the world's best bean burrito then look no further.  I hope ponchos lives on forever because I am now dependent on ponchos bean burrito for my very survival.

Okay listen I'm updating my review and it is with sadness that I report that I will never come here again. The quality of service is just so absolutely terrible. The food is nothing short of fantastic, if you ever receive it. They are painfully understaffed 365 days per year and completely unapologetic about it. The fact that any restaurant thinks that it is okay to never refill drinks, get every order wrong, make you wait 45 minutes to get your check, ask for go boxes but never receive them, is just criminal.  I hate that this place makes me so mad because it has such potential. Goodbye old friend.

Back in the day I used to drive all the way from Surprise to eat here, yes the food was that good. They used to have the most killer Pollo Fundido as well as amazing chunky salsa. 

Time has certainly changed this place.. we started with a cheese crisp with green chiles, delicious.. nice and crispy with just the right amount of chile strips.. also ordered their killer chunky salsa which was as good as I remember it. 

Then come my Pollo Fundido swimming, Im serious about this, swimming in a pool of grease!! They didn't even bother draining the thing before tossing it onto my plate. Was disgusting too, not even like clear oil but dark brown grease. Vile. Then the Misters Sampler showed up.. this thing was a fucking mess! You couldn't tell what was what under the piles of sauce and lettuce until you took a bite. Mini chimis were burnt, mini tacos burnt, tamales, cold and hard.. was a complete wreck. 

After a few bites we called it.. major loss of appetite.. a shame too cause the salsa was actually really good but the entrees were inedible. 

Meanwhile, the Mister was attached to the toilet within a few hours of eating here.. he was sick all day the next too.. so word of caution, eat here at your own risk.

Im sure going to miss the good meals I used to have here, what a real shame.

The food here is very good. Although I haven't really tried anything besides the Pollo Fundido (Fried chimichanga filled with shredded chicken and topped off with a jalapeno cream sauce.) Amazing!! My husband had tried a lot of other things in the menu, but always goes back to the Pollo Fundido. 

The service is not the best since they're almost always packed inside. You will probably only see your server an average of three time like mentioned in another review. The space is very limited it used to be a regular home which was converted into a restaurant.  You sit very close to the other table little space to move around. If you can ask to be seated in the first dining room area. The rooms in the back of the restaurant get very hot and uncomfortable.  They also have a bar if you like to eat around loud music.

For the non-Mexican food lover, you'll find their hamburgers to be adequately sufficient. It's just a Plain Jane type of burger, lettuce and tomatoes. A simple man. Yet, good and filling, it's a burger at a Mexican place. Nachos would be a second choice, but they're really just mini, greasy, delicious  tostadas. I love them! Order the Small - you're not going to be able to finish it, so don't bother ordering the Large. Oooh, almost forgot about a picky kid's choice: a giant cheese crisp! This can also be an appetizer for a large group, just add salsa zigzags all over that biznatch. 

Slightly Mexican inclinations? Their lovely,  giant chimichanga is what I set my standards to. It's delicious. 

Margaritas are strong and the staff are friendly. Salsa is super spicy and chips crisp.  Grew up here and when I visit Arizona, Poncho's is always a must.

At Poncho's you will find good Mexican food, but there is always a weird musty smell that I can't get over.  If you do go, I reccomend the frozen margaritas.  They are poured straight out of a machine, but they are delicious.
My go-to place when I want Mexican.  Pollo Fundido  is excellent, Chili Relleno is my go-to comfort food.  We always feel welcome.  It can feel close, but the place was a house at one time.

Went to Poncho's on a football  Sunday and sat in the lounge. We had the chorizo cheese crisp, which was really good. And for entrees we had the Muchacho Grande and the Pollo Fundido. As good as they both were, we liked the Pollo Fundido a lot more. Maragaritas were decent. Would definitely go back.

First off, what the heck kind of place charges their customers $1.00 for the "good" salsa to go with your chips, puts them in a soup cup (not bowl) and no free refills? The free salsa tasted more like ketchup than hot sauce. To top that off, why would any mexican food restaurant offer you EITHER beans OR rice with your meal, not both?!?!? And then when you ask for both you get charged extra without them telling you!?!? WTF!?!?!? Food wasn't even that great. 
I don't know why we came back. Service was not the greatest. Felt bad for the party next to us cause they got seated right before us and we got our food before she even asked if they were ready to order. Manager was chatting it up with another table and one of the bus boys came by and she said something to him and once he was out of the room started talking crap about him to the customers. Will NOT be back.

I've been a patron of this establishment since I was a young child. When I thought of authentic Mexican food, I immediately think of Poncho's. It has been a many years since the last time I've eaten there and had a hankering for some good Mexican food. However, I was deeply disappointed in what I experienced. I ordered the Tamale Especiale with the  jalepeno cream cheese sauce. I know the sauce is the same from the Pollo Fundido (my favorite), but it tasted nothing like it. I tasted no cream cheese. It tasted like sour cream with chunks of jalepeno. Even the jalepeno didn't taste like jalepeno! The chicken was flavorless. I couldn't tell there was chicken in it. My mother ordered a beef chimichunga with red sauce. She complained that it was also had no flavor and got sick afterward. I hope this is a one time occurrence because through the many years of eating there I've never had a bad meal...never!
Had the Pancho Villa burrito and ate it in the El presidente room...If this place is good for the one and only Slick Willy Clinton its good enough for me..Highly recommend!!!!

I went with a newborn son and it was way too crowded for a car seat to steer around the restaurants weird floor plans but food was delicious. Definitely would go again however server was a bit distracted and would often forget about us.

My first time here and I left never wanting to come back again. Our server was nice but it seemed like she had no idea what she was doing. Maybe she was new but non the less anytime we asked her a question about the menu or drinks she had to go ask someone else. She didn't even bring out silverware for us when she brought out our food and we were always waiting on drink refills. It took forever to get drinks and order the food. I was starving by the time we ordered and i ordered the taquitos with bean and rice. The shell of the taquitos were over fried and  when you bit into the food it tasted like stale chips. My other friends got tacos and they said the same thing about the taco shells. On top of all that the credit machine was down when we were trying to pay . She came back and asked if we had cash and when we told her we didn't, she kept saying well we can only take cash so I don't know. We asked her if she could take our card numbers down and charge it when the machine was working again but she said we couldn't. She said they were trying to fix it so we waited another hour and half and by that time I was pissed. She didn't come back to see if there was anything they could do while we waited and kinda just forgot about us. After all the waiting she comes back with the credit card number on the receipt and told us to put the phone number on the back and they will call us when they are going to charge the card. Service sucked and food sucked

I have been going to Ponchos for at least twenty years and I am always satisfied.  The food is heavy - the way Mexican food should be.  You cannot go wrong with the chimichangas, Mexican pizza, green chili or flautas.  

A few years ago during a trip to Phoenix, President Clinton came into Ponchos.  They commemorated the event with a mural on the wall where Clinton sat.  Also the chips and salsa are bottomless and fantastic!

My wife is a die hard but that's because she grew up eating here. I can say this is not a bad place for food. They make a good everything. 

We had 
2x 3 way burrito green chili, red chili and bean with green sauce on top. 
1x Pollo fundito with rice (excellent)
A ton of chips and salsa 
The bill was slightly over $20...lol freaking MCD'S is more.

A very authentic Mexican Food spot on south side of Phoenix. The style of the restaurant is very colorful and festive. Every time I have been there it is busy especially on the weekends breakfast thru lunch times. Had the green burro with rice and beans and it tasted like my own nana made it. Would definitely go back and enjoy other dishes.

Love the food here! They serve you so much food for the price. The reason I give 4 instead of 5 is that it's always so full and doesn't do reservations so there's always a wait time. It's also a very small space, it's very cramped and can feel hot inside. If you don't mind the wait and space it's definitely worth it. Just don't go super hungry that you can't wait.

LOVE the Nachos with sour cream on the side, as well as the chips, salsa and Margaritas.  My old "go-to" menu item was the Pollo Fundido before I changed my eating habits :)  My recommendation is to go at happy hour and sit in the bar area!
Ponchos has the best pollo fundido in town. not to mention the Mexican pizza with red or green Chile is fire!!!!! And if you try the child's & salsa you'll want to slap yo lady!!! Lol...(bomb)
Interior was cute and design was nice . Got a poncho vila- not a big fan of it but overall great experience .
Been going here since I was a kid in the 90's. Food is still great but service is crap. All young kids waitering and it takes 20 minutes to get a beverage yet alone some silverware.

Hands down, the best shredded beef taco I've had in Phoenix.  Fun atmosphere, affordable and casual.  It appears to be a busy joint so I'd expect a little wait for a table unless you're ok with bellying up to the bar.  Can't wait to go back!
Rude Hostess. She didn't receive me and my party with a smile at all nor made eye contact with me.

Worst "Mexican" food ever
Do not waste your time or money here
Everything's canned and the employees need training on customer service skills. 
This is a great place to throw a few back and eat once you get the munchies.

My family ordered despite how unwelcoming the employees were and upon getting our food we were GREATLY disappointed with everything it's the worst appearance and taste.

Their 3 way chimichangas are to die for. I was talking to a friend about mexican food. I said there is only one mexican food restaurant that I will eat at. Their food is authentic. He said let's try it and it better be good. We get there for lunch and is full as usual. We ordered 2 3 way chimichangas to go. He sat in his car and said let me try it before we leave. He tasted it and he said wow this is pretty good. I live like 10 min away. He kept it on his lap and could not stop eating it at stop lights. By the time we got to my house his plate was gone. I have been going to Ponchos for a couple of decades and that is the only mexican restaurant I will eat at. I normally go out to eat alot of italian and sushi but Ponchos will always draw me back. You have to try their 3 way chimichangas when you go there.

Ponchos is the best! My family has been going to Ponchos since the 80's and can't get enough. If you want true Arizona style Mexican food, this is the place. The chili relleno is awesome, the chimi's are also very good. It's loud and very informal, but always a great time!

Had takeout from here...the food was hot and worth the wait! The tamales were really good! I plan on going back! They have amazing salsa and great service in their Togo area. I haven't eaten inside yet but I plan on it! Great food!
The food here was so good my wife and I overate to the point that we can't even drive away because we both are scared we're gonna vomit. Will be back. So good.
Been coming here since 94' and still.  I like sitting at the bar are, play good music and good clientele.   And ofcourse you'll run into some high school friends! Lol

There lines out the door says it all good mixture of great Mexican food lots of good salsa and chips we have plenty on the menu and they like to keep it a small family owned business it's a great place to get a authentic food if you're in the area

The food was not bad, but the restaurant was filthy! The service was horrible, when we asked for our server they got highly irate. Worst restaurant experience I have had in years, I would not recommend this restaurant no to anyone.

I would always go into the restaurant with the best experience and so loved by the employees, but this time it was the most worst experience with service I had possible gotten. Never got forks, literally asked for water 10 times, and on top of the the waitress was arguing with a family sitting behind us that had the most simplest request. Made me not want to eat there again that's how bad it was. Hopefully they get rid of the waitress...

Huge disappointment. Service was terrible. You are seated at awarkard tables with other diners only having you eating as the view. Our waitress was less than impressive. Walked over said you ready to order?! What do you want to drink?! I'll be back to take your order. Almost 10 minutes later (literally) she brought our drinks then seemed shocked when we started our order and said I'll be right back. After returning she took our order one item was the chicken avocado salad - she asked what kind of dressing? I asked for the options and the were all awful. Ranch 1000 island and creamy Italian? For a Mexican salad sure sounds great. We also ordered fajitas when the arrived we expected a sizzling platter of smoky grilled veggies and steak. We got a plate full of liquid several strips of semi but meat raw onions semi cooked bell peppers and a tomato slice. The guacamole looked like brownish grey goop. Disgusting. We told the waitress when she dropped off the plate ideas not fajitas and she just said ok here's your tacos and walked away. Never to her from her again till our check arrived. We asked to speak with a manager who looked at the fajitas and said oh it looks more like teriyaki beef...wth! We had them removed fomrom our bill but the overall service, food and attitudes are plenty to keep us away.

AMAZING mexican food!  i am no fan whatsoever of mexican food...BUT i AM a major fan of Don Poncho's mexican food...specifically their carnitas and asada tacos and sopes...i can only speak for these two items.  And i will keep on coming back for them!  delicious!

I made a wrong turn to avoid an accident scene on Baseline Road...GOOD THING! I found Panchos!  This place is super cheap and super delicious!  I usually order the El Crudo burrito ($6.45 only!) and I love the Mole sauce!  The burrito is stuffed with Machacha beef and comes with rice and some lettuce...the sauce is the best Mole sauce I have ever had.  

I have never had to wait for my food. Although the parking lot can get packed. This place is amazing. if I'm ever in phoenix again on business I'm going here!  

Love it. 

btw, I was on  mission to find some bomb ass Mexican food and was somewhat disappointed. People kept referring me to Filbertos.  WTF Go to PANCHOS!

Not what you would expect this neighborhood.
Not really bad, but uninspired. Service was ok.
Will try one more time because it is convenient.

Came here with friends and family for a birthday party on Sunday and really liked it! This is my third time here and it just gets better and better each time. I wish that I was a little bit more hungry as I just ended up getting the albondigas soup. The soup was good and came with a side of lemons and tortillas, but I wish that they gave you a little bit more as it just came with three meatballs and a little bit of rice. It was not the best albondigas I ever had, but it was good. I ended up adding some of their amazing guacamole, sour cream, and salsa to the soup to make the soup a little bit thicker. Unfortunately the soup was a little thin and greasy, but again once you add some sides it makes up for the lack of thinness. 

Our waitress was very nice and attentive to our needs. Our salsa, chips, and water were constantly refilled and I felt appreciated that I was there. Speaking of the salsa I loved the house salsa that came with our chips. It was full of flavor and had just enough heat to open up my senses. One of my friends ordered their chunky salsa, which costs $1, and you could see the chunks of tomato and peppers--very good, but sucks that you have to spend $1 for a small cup.

I checked out my friends food, which was a mix of tacos, chimichangas, burritos, refried beans, and taco salads--all which I sampled and were great. I just think next time I will come with a bigger appetite and try one of those entrees. I would come at a different time as the wait was a little long, but worth it. I will be back when I am in Phoenix.
Been going here since I was a little girl. Always always good. Get the albondigas soup!

Simply the worst dining experience I've had. From the moment I walked in the experience was just AWFUL. The hostess was rude and not welcoming whatsoever, an older lady that was waiting to be seated even made a remark to her about her rudeness, so I know it wasn't just me that noticed it. We asked to be seated in their "lounge" area as we were planning to have a couple of drinks. Once sat, one waitress came by to take our drink order(mind you we hadn't received drink menus) so we began asking about their drinks and pricing. Her response was that she didn't know, so I asked for a drink menu, she came by, dropped it off and disappeared. About 10 minutes later another waitress came by to take our drink order I inquired about a beer, which was not on the drink menu provided to us, and again the response was that she didn't know. She finally came back after she checked and we placed our drink order. We waited over 20 minutes for two simple drinks, a michelada and a Budweiser in the bottle. Unless they're brewing the beer in the back, I really don't think it should take that long for two beer drinks. But since we were sitting in the bar area, we could see what was taking so long. Clearly this place is a place of "usuals", because two ladies were getting in an altercation and other patrons from all over the bar area knew them by name and the staff caters directly to their usuals. One usual walked in and not even 2 minutes later, her margarita was ready for her at the bar... But I waited over 20 minutes for a simple beer and some tomato juice, that was not tasty at all. When we finally asked if we could order food, the waitress off the bat handed us "to-go"
Boxes which was really confusing since we hadn't even placed our order. Sounds welcoming, right? When we finally got our food, it was sub-par, the usual Americanized Mexican food, nothing spectacular as people had raved to me about. About 15 minutes into our meal, the check was dropped off. We weren't asked if we wanted another drink, nothing. We felt we were being rushed out of the establishment. My friend who I was with was not happy and asked when she came by if we couldn't stay to have another drink(hypothetically, because we didn't really want to stay somewhere where we felt unwanted) because it felt like she wanted us out. Her response was that we could stay as long as we needed she had just dropped off the check for when we were ready... But we looked around, and noticed that no other tables around us had checks dropped off, some who had been there longer than us, again the "usuals". 
I've seen another review regarding they felt their service was poor due to their race, and my friend who I was with felt exactly the same way. I don't like to make everything about race, but sometimes, it's hard not to.  
All-in-all, it was a disappointing experience. I moved here over 10 years ago and always heard about this place, and when I finally had the chance to go, I was excited, but wasn't expecting this experience. I am a self-proclaimed foodie and a localist and this is a local establishment I will not  support again.

Authentic mexican food.  This is a long time family spot and I continue to go there whenever I feel like I need a great taco, rice and beans.  Never had a bad service in almost two decades of going there.  Could not recommend enough.

We live in the area and have gone here for years. Last night we were treated so badly the minute we walked in the door that I would say that we will never be back and will let others know the way we were treated. It was an awful experience to say the least.
The bartender has threatened to put eyedrops in the drinks of patrons that "piss her off" I will include a screenshot for proof.
I ordered a pollo fundido and hubby had the carne asada special. Food was really good, definitely recommend trying this pkace out if you're ever on the south side.

I ate there yesterday because of this post. The food was not edible. I ordered the Pollo Fundido and Dos Enchiladas with shredded beef. The Pollo Fundido has a terrible taste from the chimichanga being fried in very dirty oil. I could not get past the flavor to take more than 2 bites. The enchilada sauce had a very strong one note flavor - can't name what flavor it was other than bad. The shredded beef had no seasoning. It taste like they cooked beef in water then shredded it apart. Do not eat here, it's a waste of money!
This is my favorite place to eat good mexican food. We eat at this place almost once a week. The service is excellent, there's not much of a wait time. Definitely a place to to eat good mexican food.

Unfortunately, I really did not enjoy my time at poncho's like my friend described to me. We were visiting Phoenix for a conference so my friend who is from Arizona mentioned Poncho's to me as one of the best Mexican restaurants in Phoenix because President Clinton specifically stopped by for authentic Mexican food. The story sounded very promising so we decided to try it out. 

The place was fairly crowded with a line about 30 minutes wait time. You could tell that the place has some history because the decorations are pretty old. Since there was a line, we felt pretty good about it just like my friend said. However, we started to feel differently as the waitress took us to our table through the restaurant. There was a very distinct smell around our table in the room. We couldn't tell whether it was the smell from the kitchen which was next to our table or the smell of old carpet that have been soaked with years of Mexican food. Regardless, what the smell was, it wasn't pleasant so here was the first impression. The menu provided some traditional Mexican food items, which were fairly authentic. However, the chips and salsa were underwhelming at the best. My main dish was again disappointing to the point that I didn't even remember what I ate. This was definitely one of most disappointing meals that I had for a long time. Personally, I will not recommend Poncho's to anyone and will not return to this place again.

I've eaten here a few times with the hopes I get something I like the next time I return considering the reviews. I still don't. The food is bland and greasy. Not very authentic IMO. They do give you a big portion for the price so I did like that. Also the service is great. I might go here again to try the famous pollo fundido. And also only because my boyfriend likes this place so I'm sure we will be here again

I Was was so excited to have lunch there. since moving to AZ i have heard so many great things about this restaurant however when I got there totally disappointed the culinary experience hasn't caught up yet in Phoenix,AZ the food was less than mediocre, And the counter tops at the bar were sticky;( this old mom-and-pop joint, is thumbs down for me.......;(

I absolutely love the Pollo Fundido. They are super generous with the creamy jalepeno sauce they top it with.

I've been here twice now and the 2nd time I swore I'd try the Chili Relleno but I couldn't resist the Pollo Fundido. Finance was happy with his combo plate both times as well. 

Can't beat the house margaritas, they are amazing. 

Salsa and guacamole is awesome. 

The location is a little questionable and intimidating, that is the only reason for 4 stars.

Food, drinks and service have never been a problem here. 

I highly recommend Poncho's, we haven't found a single place that beats it yet.
Came here the other day and i honestly feel like this place is overrated. Ordered a tostada and it was SOGGY by the time it got to my table. For this kind of food it's nothing I can't make at home.
The food was good. The salsa and chips were freshly made. My plate was served. With beans and cheese just the way I like it. The server was very nice.

I feel like a less than glowing review of this place will get me kicked out of South Phoenix but here goes: the food is just okay and the prices are higher than they should be. I feel like the historical significance of Poncho's as a South Phoenix staple has created a false picture. I can spend less and get more higher quality food just outside of South Phoenix or I can spend less and get the same quality food within SPHX. Either way I actually cannot remember the last time I was willing to pay Poncho's prices. It's just not worth it.

Yeah, pretty decent mexican food, GREAT big giant margaritas.  

Done lunch and now dinner 3 times here.  I don't wanna advertise this too much because I'm afraid that if too many people catch on, the restaurant will figure it out and put a stop to it BUT...Once a buddy and I figured out the secret to getting hammered on their margaritas for cheap:   Order a pitcher of margaritas with NO ICE.  They are OK with that!   You get 3x the amount of margarita, and they will still bring you glasses full of ice.  Go figure.  Winning, Duh!  

I guess by reading these reviews that it's hit or miss with the food, but their margaritas are worth going there for, even if the food does suck on your particular visit. They are just damn good margaritas. KILLER margaritas.  Seriously.

Also, regardless of the food and other qualities that make a restaurant what it is, my take-aways are always based to some degree on how good of a time I had there.  If the food sucks, but I still have a good time, I'm gonna remember that and that's gonna be reflected in my reviews.  Maybe it's just the good company, I don't know, but at this place, I have always had a good time, and I don't remember the food ever being less than good.  

Go have yourself a good time!

I have heard many good things about this place and then saw mixed reviews on Yelp.  Bill Clinton even ate here.  (I don't think George Washington slept here!  You east coasters will get the joke.)

My overall opinion is that Poncho's is a run of the mill Mexican restaurant.

- my server was very nice and attentive (except for refilling my water) but the kitchen was very slow

- the chips were fresh but still very greasy

- the Pollo Fundido, one of their signature entrees was a good sized but soggy chimichanga with lots of moist chicken stuffed inside it.  It was then drowned in a white cream cheese jalapeño sauce.  All very salty to me.

- I ordered rice and beans that we're okay at best.  I know they are refried beans but these were also greasy.

Bottom line - with over 20+ Mexican restaurants within a few miles of here I will continue trying new ones vs returning here.

Sorry Poncho's!

Honest Mexican restaurant. Extensive menu, never been disappointed. Although I usually opt for the Poncho Villa. There is a mural of Bill Clinton, he dined here when he was president. Ladies still like to take their picture at the Clinton table. (Actually, under it)! Excellent party platters at a good price. Only drawback, it's getting harder to pop in for lunch.

We found Ponchos by stumbling over it while looking for another address. It was lunch time so why not???  The short review is - just stop what you are doing right now and go there for lunch! You live in Tucson and it is in Phoenix? I don't care, leave early it's worth it.

OK a bigger review.

Big surprise! 
First -- The parking area is deceptive - go to the back instead of squeezing into one of those front spaces.

Then - go in and ignore any line that might have formed - it will clear up really fast.

Now sit down and prepare to be surprised. I bet you think most Mexican food is just Lettuce Cheese and some meat arranged in different presentations with Salsa. Well that is true but Ponchos actually is a different taste and it is wonderful. 

Chips - the chips are light and crunchy not burned, thick and greasy. You may well ask to buy a bag of them to take home. We did. Twice now.

Salsa - the salsa comes in a squeeze bottle and I was really skeptical because I like it in a dish  to dip out of. The salsa is best served like they do it and it is spectacular. Not to hot, nice tang and flavor just goes all over your mouth. They provide a dish if you want to put the Salsa in the dish. (get takeout to go with those chips you are going to buy)

I have now had Tacos (you just have to always do that) and Enchiladas. Both were an experience. My associate had the red chili in  a burro and  I tried it. You really should just drive there to try the red chili.

This is a small thing but I like coffee and restaurants frequently keep coffee around or do not have it ready. Ponchos keeps fresh coffee hot and ready, and it is good coffee.

My only issue - no Posole and I bet these guys could make a killer Posole.

The host was a little bitch....telling me that she needed to get past me....well if she paid a little bit of attention she would've noticed that i had nowhere to move bc i was letting her customers get past me...as to the food, it was good i ordered some chimichanga or.something that had white cheese on it...either way it was good ...the set-up of the tables sucks....feels like an overcrowded military cafeteria, not a restaurant

Love this place! The food is delicious. The salsa is fantastic and better yet, they sell it. Took home a pint and plenty of left overs. Knocking one star off because service can be extremely slow at times.

Just went here with the hubby because the yelpers said it was awesome. I ordered the pollo fundido and it was awesome! I have never had it before so maybe I am looking for the wrong thing because I dont have anything to base it off of. I scarfed it down. it was amazing! 

Hunny got two beef tamales. I was disappointed by them. They were just pulled beef in a corn tortilla, not wrapped in the corn meal and husk. He scarfed them down anyway though (he doesn't know he was cheated).

We will definitely go back, when we can fork up the money. It was a little pricey for the quality of the tamales but other than that it was great.

More customer service. I had called my order in the said 10 minutes so I get there in 15 minutes still not ready took an additional 10 more minutes.  when I got up to the window it took them 5 minutes to even acknowledge I was there. A girl seen me didn't smile or nothing and just started putting cups up. Not once did she say she will be right with me. Not good service at all

The food here was shockingly awesome given its appearance!  

We went here randomly because another restaurant was closed.  It does not look like much.  Sketchy parking lot - complete with a pile of vomit by the ramp!  The inside is cramped.  We ate in a room that looked like it had been something else originally, with way too many tables crammed in.

I ordered a pina colada, and stupidly chose the large size.  Large is a ridiculous understatement!  This thing was the size of a fish bowl or something.  Not one of those stupid beta fish bowls either.  The large drinks mean business!!  It was pretty good too.

Everything we ate was really, really good.  I had the burrito and my friend had a taco salad.  Everything was great, including the salsa, but the taco shell was AMAZING.  So perfectly cooked and tasty.  It's weird to get this excited over a taco shell, but it's totally warranted.  So good!!  I would definitely go out of my way to get something with this amazing shell in the future.

Well, I have been coming for any years. I don't live in Phoenix anymore but it is tradition to come to Ponchos every time we visit our family. Today we had an issue with a food item. Katie D our server along with the manager adjusted their policy to make us happy, Great restaurant, great service, great prices

I have been going to this place probably since I was in the womb. They have good prices and good food. I love the chips and salsa. I wish they still did the cheese crisp on mondays for free after 5pm (maybe they will bring it back hint, hint)...
It is in a smaller converted house in south phoenix with a take out area in front and a bar in the back. This place fills up quick on the weekends be prepared. Only thing I do not like is sitting out in the main area when you first walk in everybody is looking at you when they walk by I prefer the back room or the bar.
YUMMY...... food try it for yourself.

Waited 25 mins for some Chips and Salsa...only to get across town and don't have what I paid for. So o call to tell them it's not right and they ask can I come back. No I won't be back for a long time..

Came back again with the same person insisting the place was great. 

I avoided the single flauta meal ($7 for a flauta with beans and rice), and got a #7 (chile relleno, rice, beans, and a flour tortilla) instead. No regrets. 

The food was great this time around, and despite being a really packed night, our waitress tonight was very attentive. She frequently brought refills and more chips and was prompt in clearing plates and bringing the bill. 

Left full and satisfied this time. 

It was probably just a bad combination of bad server and disappointing food last time that led to the poor rating, but I'd definitely recommend the place now.

I was visiting Scottsdale for business and my local cousins took me to Poncho's for dinner. This is their favorite Mexican restaurant in the area. I tried the sampler with a presidential theme. Good variety of the Mexican dishes available. I enjoyed each piece of the plate and the addition of a large marg made it even better. I have it on his authority that the pollo fondito is awesome. Why only 4 and not 5? Slow to non-existent service at the front and really short handed waitstaff.

This place is still as good as it used to be way back in the day! Poncho's has that real and authentic Mexican food. All of their items are delicious, and I do mean all of them. Please do yourself a favor and eat at Poncho's, you will not regret it. Oh, and their red salsa is muy delicioso! Prices are more than reasonable for the quality of the food that is served. Also, expect to wait a bit for a table on popular nights such as Friday & Saturday. But the food is definitely worth the wait.

It's exactly what I'd expect for an old school Mexican food place. Yeah, it's cramped a little. It's old. The food is the best Mexican food for white people in Phoenix. The hot sauce is to die for. Chips and fresh and endless. I love the gringo Fundito. If you're thinking about eating at this place, stop thinking and start getting down there to get a seat. It can get crowded very quickly. End of story.

Ponchos is an average to good place to get take out or eat in Mexican-AMERICAN food. That is to say It is fried, topped with cheese, and not to complex. The prices are good and the service is fast and because of this is a staple in South Phoenix.

Best straight-up sit-down Mexican restaurant in Phoenix!  I've driven over 40 minutes on several occasions just to eat here.

This place is really tiny, but that's because it used to be a residence.  Eventually the business grew so much that the owners moved out and converted their home into a restaurant.

The food is great, and really inexpensive.  Everything I've had is excellent.  The staff is friendly and the service is fast.  It's one of the places I like to take visiting friends and family.

Not the best, but definitely not the worst. Good is always consistent and reliable. Waitresses are nice, and usually on top of our needs. Food usually comes real quick. If you are looking for a solid Mexican food place, this is the right choice.

TALK ABOUT GHETTO!! I was disgusted to be honest. Walking into that place was like walking in to a old Crack house turned mexican restruant. First off, I don't mind driving out to a good mexican restruant, but seriously this place was so dirty, run-down, and as I could tell not run by good management. SECONDLY, and i could not believe this even happened, as soon as we sat down there was a full on fight between customers in the bill Clinton room. I had my phone out ready to call 911 because this fight was going on way to long.  It is such a small restaurant, with family and kids at just about every table. What kind of family restruant has a fight break out? A ghetto mexican restruant does. And not only that but the silverware, the pee yellow cups they use for water looks like overused cafeteria cups from the 90s. I think the only reason this place is still open is because the locals in South pheonix must not have any other authentic mexican restruants around. Anyways just so many things about this restruant is soo unappealing, i dont know why I even went. The worst experience at a restruant ive ever had. Not to mention we called earlier in the day to make reservations and they still seated us in the wrong place. Food was whatever, and service was below average.
This is one of the best Mexican restaurants in Phoenix. The chips and salsa to start are fantastic and the Pollo Fundido is insanely good
My friend reminded me of the best part... When we walked outside after our horrible meal, there was a nasty used green condom on the floor. Yuck.
Love Love Love this place.  Authentic Mexican food.  I had the beef tacos and beef tamale plate with rice and beans!  So yummy.  Highly recommend

Cheesy.  Truly, it's a little too cheesy for my tastes, although I've grown to accept this as a normal problem with these Americanized Mexican restaurants.  But this is a great little place that has dining inside and a take-out window outside.  It's a great place to pick up an enchilada-style burrito on the way home.
I loved their food ,but the service has gone down.You now have grumpy waiters,that don't care about the service. I'm done going there.

So good here.  So good.  I asked my friend who lives in Phoenix what's a place that is "Phoenix" and I can't eat anywhere else.  She recommended Poncho's and man, I am glad she did.

I had already eaten a bag of Ruffles sour cream and cheddar, so my stomach wasn't feeling that great.  But I had to get the pollo fundido, and it was amazing.  It was pretty big.  Ok, enough about that, just know, it was amazing.  I am salivating thinking about it.

The chips and salsa was great.  Everything was great.  Go here for some authentic Mexican food.  Yum.

Poncho's is one of my favorite spots to come to with my family & co-workers. The food is great and very rarely do I have any complaints on it. I would give it a 4 or even a 5 star if it weren't for the hit and miss customer service. The last time I was there for lunch with some co-workers, we had crappy customer service. Our waitress was very short and dismissive. She barely looked at us when talking to us. She slapped the receipt on our table and ran off. Didn't ask us if we needed anything else or if it was all on one bill. When we told her we were paying seperately, she took off again and brought us back our separate receipts. She was annoyed that we didn't tell her we wanted separate checks. Um.... she didn't give us a chance!

Yeah,  wow,  Poncho's this Mexican food is amazing.
I just knew I hit the jackpot after I saw my first order, the sampler platter.
tamales are great here i get the green corn.  Man I'll drive here just to fulfill a tamale attack.  

The place has a cool set up winding around room to room it just never ends. I"m glad its open a little late for those late night customers.  

Watch out for lunch here during the week it can get full, its one of those place people know where to find.  Just of Central in South Phoenix.  I don't get out here that much 
Destination location for sure.
My personal note: we live in Arizona, experiencing some of the best Mexican food America does not know about  makes me really enjoy the valley
"Poncho's Mexican food,  Kevin U. place  to try."


Kevin

For being a legend I would say that Ponchos is not up to par, nor do they have the best authentic Mexican food in south Phoenix. The albondigas soup that they make is always too salty, and the meatballs are never fully cooked. I've ordered the soup many times in hopes that it will be cooked and they fail every time. I always end up putting my soup in the microwave to completely cook the meatballs. The tacos are extremely greasy, and the restaurant needs renovating. The chips and salsa is about all I will eat. I've been asked by coworkers on where to go for great Mexican food and I always advise them to go to Comedor Guadalajara. Ponchos is NOT the bees knees and I would avoid it. Sorry but they just don't cut it.

A Phoenix Native friend introduced me to this local gem years ago. So I've been a loyal customer to this awesome, amazing establishment for almost 10 years to date. The food is always out of sight, delicious, fresh and always on point. The prices are very reasonable and one definitely gets what you pay for. No matter what you order from their extensive menu, I don't believe you can go wrong. My ultimate fave at this place is the Pollo Fundido! The picture in my post does not do it justice . The white jalapeño sauce is to die for and illuminates my taste buds . It can get very crowded at times but it is definitely worth the wait. I have yet to have a bad experience with the food or customer service. If there is any "complaint" I have about this restaurant it's that it can get a bit loud with the crowds that are present at times. But, if you don't mind a lively establishment to enjoy tasty Mexican food, then definitely check this place out!
Food is amazing! I'm not a huge fan of dining in and the pick up window is shady at night but the food is worth it.

I love Mexican food, and Poncho's just might be why.  This restaurant is great...the food is soooo good.  I love the chips and salsa and the Mexican pizza, bean chimichanga and the bean and cheese burrito enchilada style are my personal faves. 

The servers are very attentive and prices are reasonable.  If you like Mexican food and you haven't been to Poncho's yet, you definitely need to add it to your list of top places to go for good Mexican food. 

Be forewarned that the food isn't healthy Mexican- this stuff is loaded with cheese and flavor!

Absolutely delicious and my favorite place in town. This meal Is always two hours long though, service is extremely slow no matter which server you get. One of my top request is don't starve my thirst and refills are hard to come by. Food makes up for the slow service, be sure to check out the coupons in the newspapers and weekly adds.

Great food and selection. Highly recommend for those looking for a nice family type establishment. This is a great place to take out of town guests who are interested in trying some good Mexican food.

The restaurant gets crowded and there is often a wait but it's worth it for the experience and the food. Be sure to go in the right door or it's a bit confusing.

Food was ok typical Mexican food the atmosphere was busy and it was a little warm inside. It's a small place and they thrive off of Bill Clinton having eaten there. I give it a 3 for food and service. However the margarita was no joke it was strong and tasty. Maybe I am a wimp but it knocked me to the floor.

I love ordering this for pick up. Very authentic feel, and if you actually dine in it's entertainment/people watching. You pick your food up at an outside counter which is very cute. The food has always been good. Best tacos even to.go! They put them in a separate wrapper. Fresh crunchy shell and moist shredded beef. Yum!

First of all, I love this place. I plan to come here regularly as long as I live in Phoenix. Before I go on to expound upon the wonders of my first dining experience here, I need to make a brief but passionate comment about the location of this restaurant. I agree that Poncho's  is a gem, but I think it does a disservice to the residents of this area to think of Poncho's as good *given the area*. Part of what makes restaurants like Poncho's so great is that they are family-run, with the passion and experience of many generations fueling their current success. In my limited time here, South Phoenix strikes me as an area that has a lot of heart and soul to it - a lot of the homes in the neighborhood have been in the family for generations, and certain restaurants here reflect this sense of the past and of community. I loved my first experience at Poncho's because it's such a great dining experience with real ties to the South Phoenix community, not in spite of this fact. 

OK, that being said, on to the food and drink! We started with thin, crispy, perfectly salted chips with some hot salsa in a bottle - best starter ever! We ordered margaritas, and our waitress (who was really down-to-earth and helpful) asked if we wanted the "big bowl" ones. "Hmmm, why not," we said (they were priced at $6.50, which is really reasonable). And we didn't regret our choice! They were a little sweet for my taste, but they still had a really great lime flavor and tasted pretty strong. Much better than the limeade Los Dos Molinos tries to pass off as margarita mix! And once we had them along with the chips, the mix started to taste less sweet and became the perfect compliment to the spice of the salsa. 

When we first saw the prices of the food, we were shocked! It was so cheap! It's really impressive that the owners have managed to keep the quality and portions so high while keeping prices so low. Based on Yelp reviews, I recommended to my husband that he try the Pollo Fundido (~$7). I tried two a la carte items - the chile relleno w/ chicken (~$5) and the shredded beef enchilada ($3.50). Everything was so rich but so good! The fried shell and the jalapeno cream cheese on the Pollo were so satisfying, the enchilada sauce was really flavorful, and the chicken was moist. The beans and rice were also really good. We enjoyed every minute of our entrees, which we continued to wash down with the margaritas. 

We left feeling full but satisfied, and we definitely look forward to coming back soon (perhaps for happy hour or to sit in the cantina, which was really lively). Thank you, Poncho's! I'm glad you exist!

I just wanted to make a comment and a recommendation. Every time I order take out, the packaging is the worst. Beans are very hot and put in a Styrofoam cup with a very thin lid that melts due to the heat and the beans are always all over the place = huge mess. They also put the hot sauce in the same cups and your lucky of the lid is on snug most times the chili spills all over the bag. I would hope that they would invest in some better quality to go paper goods.
Food is always great the 1 star review is due to the to go containers.

Not impressed. 

I got the shredded beef chimichanga with red chili for the 1st time, long wait (about 20 min, with only a couple of people waiting) and it was really good.  Went back a second time and was not expressed with the green chili, had to many big pieces of onions in my chimichanga.  I really liked minced onions and these were Not minced.  Maybe they should warn you about the onions!!  

The last time we went back the lady at the take out counter was not in a good mood.  we ordered a chimichanga with red chili and a smothered chicken burrito.  She told us it will be 45 minutes.  So we patiently waited for what we hoped was going to be good Mexican food.  45 minutes later we got our food and ordered was all wrong.  She gave us a chicken chimichanga instead of smothered chicken burrito and a plain bean burrito.  We referenced back to our receipt and it was not itemized, no details of what we ordered or what we were charged for.  It took another 30 minutes to have them retake and fix our order and then another 30 minutes to get our food. We waited 1hr 45min.  service was horrible and 8 dollars for a burrito that we waited almost 2 hours to take back home and eat... Will not be driving all the way to south phoenix for Ponchos.

Hmmmm....didn't really impress me when i heard former President Clinton ate here in a whim on one of his trips in PHX. i was more distracted by this eatery being centrally located on a grimey street as well as the odd smell that greeted us in the narrow halls of the waiting area. It surprised me that the odd smell did not deter the number of people who were dining here. There was a brief wait time as this small eatery was packed in every room-including the bar's dining area. There was also a wait for the takeout line which they had conveniently outside...must be something worth yelping about....

So i decided to order what my cousin has been raving about-the chimichangas. I've eaten many a chimichangas before but never...a beef chimichanga... even with its regular guacamole +sour cream combo ever touched  the one i had at Ponchos! Simply stated-the overall meal came fast, FRESH & was filling. Now i understand how certain foods can trigger a massive release of endorphins throughout your body....i stuffed myself enough to put me in a food coma. Now i understand that i could never go back to a 'chain' Mexican restaurant again. 

Affordable as is delicious-Ponchos proves that QUALITY of food isn't necessarily determined by price-as some of the best & most authentic cuisines are truly hidden treasures in local neighborhoods waiting to be found...thank you cousin for helping me discover this gem!

The menu may look very typical (http://www.ponchosaz.com/eimenu/) but you'd only know the taste difference if you ate here & experienced it for yourself. Poncho's wont disappoint.

I've been coming here for over 20 years now and their food is always amazing! I definitely recommend getting a green burrito with one of their famous margaritas. They also have great happy hour for appetizer and drinks.

WARNING: Everything is super deep fried... Been here twice and everything was way to greasy.

Have have been told they have a great happy hour including $10 pitchers of Margaritas. I'll shall have to try and repost my findings...

Best Mexican food I've ever had. Came here all the time as a kid and will continue to come here as long as I'm in Arizona. I've had bad service here but you get that everywhere you go. I will continue to come because the food is that good. It's even worth a 2 hour wait.

I went to Poncho's for my first time and I will not be going back after this, The young lady in the front was SO RUDE and was also taking personal phone calls while we were waiting just get seated & the place wasn't even full for the time we had to wait  and another reason is it's so expensive and the food is no good. My nephew ordered the carne asada and it was so flavorless and dry, We told the waitress about it and she even agreed and she even said that no one ever ends up liking the carne asada. Luckily she was nice enough to take that plate off our bill. The only thing I liked was the chips!

Solid Mexican American food. The place is like a old house with very low ceilings. The service is very non memorable.

Serving sizes were quite large.

Price...Da' BOMB!
Food...Da' BOMB!
Service...Da' BOMB!
Ponchos...Da' BOMB!

Highlight: Chicken Fundido w/ extra Jalapeno Cream Cheese...Manifiq!
The food was delicious, authentic style Mexican food! The drinks were delicious and not over priced. Food portions are huge! The only downside is that during dinner it's VERY busy, worth the wait!

To give you an idea of what I thought, I was going to take a picture of my meal... but I ate it first.

I got the Pollo Fundido, which is their signature dish. it was fantastic. It's basically a chicken chimichanga enchilada style. The sauce on that smothers the chimichanga was the most delicious sauce I've ever tasted. I took a bite and couldn't stop eating. It's like they took all that was good in the world and put it in a sauce. 

The chips were also very good. In all honesty, the first batch was good but the second batch of chips were a little stale. Still, a must stop for lunch or dinner if you're ever near South Phoenix.

I'm definitely going back.
Such good food. I would suggest this place to anyone visiting the area! Oh, and Autumn was an awesome server!

Very good authentic Mexican food. Don't judge this place from the outside lol. But very good. I got the pollo fundido with extra sauce. Husband got the chicken tacos with a cheese enchilada. Salsa was spicy and addicting. I just wish my side of jalapeños were fresh sliced jalapeños not the pickled kind to add more kick to my pollo. Service was great and prices were very reasonable.

Love this place.  Every time we make the trip from Tucson to Phoenix I get this craving for Poncho's.  The building must have been an old house from the 1930's and converted into a restaurant.  There are so many nooks and crannys to get lost in.  But when you make your way in you are greeted by this lovely older lady who is full of piss and vinegar with a great sense of humor who leads you to your table.  We were there Sat. at about 2.00PM.  The place was packed with large families who seem to know the wait staff pretty well.  Everyone is so friendly and efficient which is a plus. Now to the real test.  The food is wonderful, rich in flavor and beautifully  presented.  Unfortunately, I am a wuss and order the same gringo dish (Chicken Enchilladas with green sauce)  Hubby orders Chile Relleno, tamale, combo plate.  The thing is those onions which are sauteed to perfection slathered all over the dish including the rice. This makes me real happy.  If you love onions this is surely the place.  It's a "must go" when heading up to Phoenix.

What a gem. This place might need an external makeover but don't judge it based on that! We had some reasonable margaritas to start. They offer complimentary chips and salsa. The salsa is super addicting!! The chips are warm and taste fresh. I ordered the green chilli burrito with beef and it was so yummy! You can get rice and beans as a side if you wish but the burrito was plenty of food for me. It comes with guacamole and sour cream on the side. Delicious! There were several things on the menu I was interested in trying. Now looking at yelp, the pollo fundido is definitely on my list when we go next. Probably a new regular spot for my parents and I. Also, I will add that the prices are very reasonable. Check this place out. Bill Clinton approves.

I went to Poncho's today for lunch with the BF and it was ok. The place was very busy, so I thought that was a good sign. We waited for a bit before being seated in one of the small rooms in the back. We were given chips and the salsa in the bowl and promised salsa in a bottle. The chips were very greasy and not that crunchy and the salsa tasted like very peppery ketchup...ick. After 5 minutes or so we were given the squeeze bottle which contained a very similar, but slightly less tomato -y, salsa...not a win. For lunch, I had the mini pollo fundido and the BF had a taco and tostada. My food was alright, the chicken on the inside of the burro was nothing special, but the sauce was good and the rice was really good. Sort of what I expect from a cheap Americanized Mexican restaurant. The BF's taco was fine....also nothing special, but not bad. The prices were decent and the portion sizes were too large. I think it's super funny that they are clinging to the fact that Bill Clinton ate here 15 years ago or so, they have the newspaper clippings all over....I definitely lol'd. Anyway, I wouldn't avoid this place, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.

If you're looking for a good Mexican food this is the spot! Whether you're looking for take out or dine in, you will not be disappointed. Their chips and salsa is delicious and service is wonderful! I am always impressed when dining  at a restaurant and refills are brought out before my drink is empty. Every time I've dined here I have always gotten refills (without asking) when my drink is half way done. And I mean every time, now that is wonderful service!!! Cost is fair for the large food portion given. Definitely a five star restaurant for great service and wonderful food!

I just got take out from Ponchos. Mom and I both ordered green corn tamales and I had my standard shredded beef taco too. I usually get a taco from there whenever I'm in Phoenix. They're just the best shredded beef tacos anywhere. Mom paid for the dinner so I didn't want to tell her my tamale was truly horrible. It was like mush and there was no corn in it. I quietly took it to the garbage and dumped it in. Then mom said, "My tamale is terrible. How was yours?" "Terrible," I admitted. She through hers away too. If it wasn't so late, I would have just taken them both back and asked for a refund.
Great food but terrible service by the beaners they have running the place that can't even speak english
Great family restaurant style place. Staff works very hard and this place can be quite busy. Hey there early for lunch and best the crowd. Food is great and the chips and salsa are very good too.

I had a chicken burrito and a beef tamale, both with green sauce & rice.  It was all delicious! The only complaint would be that the tamale was kinda light on the beef and heavy on the masa. Our waitress was very efficient & accommodating. I LOVED their fresh, warm, light & crispy tortilla chips. The salsa was pretty good, too. I also loved the paintings on the walls there, one being of President Clinton dining there. Overall very enjoyable dining experience. Would definitely go again.

My favorite mexican food restaraunt.  The #4 lunch is the awesome, red or green burro enchilada style, rice and beans.  Good chips n salsa too. The pancho villa burro is good also.  My mom is a picky eater but ate her whole burrito when i took her.
Since my last review, we have had a few trips where the service was great! Food is amazing as always, they definitely deserve the 5 star

Poncho's is one of the many places that you're tempted to not review because it means more people will come.  The place is already packed almost any night we go so it's not like it's a secret, and most everyone knows about how Clinton ate here when he came to town which gives it some good Mexican food street-cred.   That said, I still know folks who would go to a chain restaurant instead of driving into "South Phoenix".  They have no idea what they are missing.

First of all, don't confuse Pancho's with Poncho's.  Pancho's is a Mexican buffet place near the Rhythm Room where you raise a flag for service.  Poncho's is an amazing restaurant with roots in Phoenix that are deep and wide.

Poncho's was created oh so many years ago by a woman who made food and sold it from her house.  Food was so amazing, business boomed even back then.  They added a walk up window to the front of their house.  Then a few tables outside.  Then they figured they might add a few tables inside.  Pretty soon they realized they needed to move out and turn the whole thing into a restaurant.  Good choice.  

I don't know how to recommend anything on the menu because everything I've tried is great.  In my household Chimi's reign supreme.  I'm a fan of a few of their combo meals. Close your eyes, point to the menu, eat.  That's my recommendation.  It will be good.  

There is a back entrance to a lounge area where you can sit at the bar or one of their tables.  Full menu service is available.  It's an awesome place to watch the game on their big screen.  Everyone has been super friendly when we've been there.  The smallish rooms created when you make a house a restaurant can get a bit loud, but it would be worse if we were in one giant room.  Again, I've never been here when it wasn't hopping.  Tuesday, generally one of the slower nights, we had a 10 min wait for a table. It's never insane, but the biggest negative has to be their waiting area.  Or waiting hall I should say.  The door in is say 6 steps to the hostess booth down a "hall where you can touch both sides with your hands at the same time easily - but there is a long bench on one side.  Since the place is packed most nights, that means a row of folks sitting, and a row of folks standing against the wall.  If this wasn't all close enough, new folks sometimes try to walk in and go up to the hostess area, or meet friends in the restaurant so they are walking down the middle.  That said, we have had some fun conversations while waiting.  Last Friday night the hostess (and older lady that I'm guessing is a partial owner) was busy running around and getting a drink, so young lady said to all the new groups that walked in while she was out, "Well, I've been coming here since I was 6, so I'll play hostess" and she started putting our names down on the list.  That turned into a "who's been coming longer" competition which was won buy a guy in his mid40's or so, we didn't ask, who'd been coming almost weekly since he was 4.   Funny how those tight quarters can lead to some pre-dinner bonding/story-sharing.  

So on top of the friendly folks, the great service, the fun wall painting (The Clinton room, as mentioned below, does have a picture of him painted on the wall.  It also has a painted representation of where his secret service guy stood during the whole meal.  One of the bus boys heard us showing it to someone and he stopped to mention to us, "Yea, and he looked JUST like that ALL night."), the amazing food, and the short from down-town commute - these are some of the best dang prices you are going to find for real sit down service anywhere.  Every once in awhile we'll get a coupon for $1/off a chimi and we often don't use them because the bill is so low it already feels like a deal.  On a recent dinner, for 4 adults w/ full meals - but no bar tab, it came to $37 AFTER a 25% tip.  

How many other places in Phoenix can you dine with a President for that price?

The fondito burrito is always my go-to at Mexican restaurants. However, the one I had here was the undisputed worst that I have ever tasted. The chicken tasted really old, or perhaps it was the kind canned like dog food. I don't know. The tamales that were my appetizer, were far from appetizing. It was like eating soggy dumplings. By the time I received my burrito, the service was as delightful as the meal. After tasting the vomitous chicken, I told my waitress that I didn't like my meal. She then asked me if I wanted to box it up to go. Seriously?! I asked another waitress(the highlight of my visit) for a manager and asked for recommendations. I must admit, this waitress was very honest with me (after I struck out with my meal). She let me know that the chicken and Carne Asada are sub-par, notified a manager, and removed my meal. So I'm thinking  why doesn't she speak freely to the cook? But that's none of my business. My secondary meal was the sampler. The canned refried beans were the stars. They really outshined the other beef jerky like, leathery meat on the tostadas.

I think this building was a house before they turned it into a restaurant because the halls are a bit narrow and the rooms are a bit small, but the food is great! They give you chips and salsa while you are waiting for your food and their salsa is home made and delicious! Their margaritas are amazing and huge (if you get the large) and pretty strong ;) . I wouldn't suggest you don't go on a Friday night for dinner because they do get pretty busy and the wait gets pretty long.

I don't know why I do this to myself... My brother told me about this place and bragged about how Bill Clinton would come down to eat here, and how their albondigas were almost as good as my moms, and how great the tacos were. Clearly this made me want to try it. We all went Sunday after the football game and it was pretty busy so I automatically thought it must be delicious. The building itself is older and looks like they haven't spent a dollar on cleaning, or on any upgrades. We sat down to a sticky table and ordered our drinks, and ordered our food soon after. I got Albondiga soup and 2 tacos. When my soup came I asked for lemon which I never got and the albondigas were waaay overcooked, I had to use my butterknife to cut thru them. When the tacos came I realized I could have gotten these at Filibertos... Nothing special to me about this place. Overall the service was descent, prices were cheap but the food was well below mediocre. I would have rather driven thru some place. My brother deserves a slap to the face for even thinking this place was descent... This place needs to stop living on the hype of Bill Clinton and make some changes... 

Last Note: Bill Clinton should be ashamed of himself to think this place was bomb... He needs higher standards!

Wow.. a waiting line on a Friday afternoon means somethings good here.. I was not disappointed. Love it all.. the presidents plate is amazing, service it top notch I will be back.. chips and salsa alone are like crack. I can't get enough

So tonight was a different experience than in the past. Tonight, we had our meal as usual. When the server brought us the check, she said "the credit card machine quit working so you have to pay cash", I said, "I have no cash, can you run it manually?". She said "Sylvia, the manager, said to go to Food City across the street, they have an ATM". 
So I had to get in my car and drive in the middle of a crazy rain storm to get cash. 
Had I known this when I first went in, I wouldn't have stayed OR I would have gone to the bank, get cash and come back. 
I know my business means little (or nothing) to them, after all, I've only been coming here for only 11 years. I've seen some bad reviews for Poncho's on here because of poor service. 
I get it now. 
Sylvia, is this your idea of a back up plan? A good manager would come up with a solution that is good for both the business AND the consumer..If there was only a way to process credit cards manually.. hhhmmmm!

Well the first two times we went there the food was great. This time it was obvious that they use canned chicken and the portions size are almost half of what they used to be. It's a shame their chicken fundido was amazing, but with the canned chicken it's gross. So to management yes we noticed you changed to canned chicken. Might want to go back to grilling your own chicken.

We love the food here however the takeout has gotten really slow. We ordered at 5:58 pm tonight and they said 15-20 minutes. We are still here waiting at 6:39 with no food. It would be okay if we didn't have an impatient 2 year old in the car, it's exactly why we got take out!! I have been going here since I was little and we love the food hopefully they can get more help or expect to wait.
